security: The dispatch instructs that the Norwegian authorities should not know about the CIA's interest in Martin Luther King Jr.'s activities. Quoting directly: "We have also taken due note of your desire that the Norwegian authorities not know of your interest in Subject's activities." Revealing this interest could harm diplomatic relations and compromise future intelligence gathering.
summary: A dispatch transmitting a memo regarding Martin Luther King Jr.'s activities, specifically noting the CIA's interest in whether King appeared at a rally in Oslo or if he planned to visit Norway in the future, while also emphasizing that Norwegian authorities should not be informed of the CIA's interest.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential dispatch, dated March 30, 1966, involves the transmittal of a memo concerning Martin Luther King Jr. to the Legal Attache, responding to an inquiry made on March 17, 1966. The memo indicates that there is no information confirming King's appearance at a rally in Oslo or any knowledge of his planned visit to Norway. The dispatch also acknowledges the desire to keep the CIA's interest in King's activities hidden from the Norwegian authorities, promising to forward any future information that becomes available.
title: Transmittal of Memo to Legal Attache Regarding Martin Luther King, Jr.
recipient: Chief of Station, London; Legal Attache, London
sender: Chief, WE; Chief of Station, Oslo
